question: The volumetric efficiency of a compressor having clearance factor c is given by:
In case of axial flow compressors for minimum fluid friction and blade tip clearance losses, the blades of an axial flow compressor are designed for ______
Centrifugal blowers can supply
choices: large volumes of air at low pressures
small volumes of air at high pressures
large volumes of air at high pressures
small volumes of air at low pressures
answer: large volumes of air at low pressures

question: Which of the following is a safety device on a compressor?
In a four stage compressor system, the, first and third stage pressures are 1 and 9 kg/cm respectively. What is the fourth stage delivery pressure?
For a six compression of air set, the minimum work conditions are:
choices: pressure rise per stage will be equal
work done in successive stages will be in geometrical progression
temperature rise in the cylinders will be the same
answer: temperature rise in the cylinders will be the same

question: Which of the following give the optimum intermediate pressure in case of two stage compression?
In air compressor performance curve a surge line represents what?
Which of the following is a displacement compressor?
Stalling of the blades of axial flow compressor is:
choices: an unsteady periodic and reversal of flow
the fixed mass flow rate irrespective of pressure ratio
the reduction in lift force at higher angle of incidence
answer: the reduction in lift force at higher angle of incidence

question: Surging is
choices: an unsteady, periodic and reversal of flow in the compressor
the fixed mass flow rate irrespective of pressure ratio
the reduction in lift force at higher angle of incidence
answer: an unsteady, periodic and reversal of flow in the compressor

question: In an axial flow compressor, the pressure rise take, place in:
An axial flow compressor is suitable for:
choices: high volume flow rates with small pressure rise
low volume flow rates with low pressure rise
high volume flow rates with high pressure rise
low volume flow rates with high pressure rise
answer: high volume flow rates with small pressure rise

question: Which of the following is a positive displacement rotary compressor?
Choking is
choices: change of mass flow rate in proportion to pressure ratio
change of mass flow rate in inverse proportion to pressure ratio
fixed mass flow rate irrespective of pressure ratio
answer: fixed mass flow rate irrespective of pressure ratio

question: Crankshaft of a reciprocating compressor is basically made of what?

The capacity of portable air compressors used for construction, mining, road building, and painting ranges from _______

Most permanent installations use piston compressors available as stock items of what pressure?
When the piston is top center of the cylinder in a double - acting reciprocating compressor:
choices: all suction valves are open and all discharge valves are closed
all suction valves are closed and all discharge valves are closed
all suction valves are closed and all discharge valves are open
all suction valves are open and all discharge valves are open
answer: all suction valves are closed and all discharge valves are closed

question: Pump used to increase air pressure above normal, air is then used as a motive power.
A device used for raising fluids from a lower to higher level.
When a pump is operating at a vacuum of 4 in Hg, which of the following is not correct?
The amount of energy actually entering the fluid from a pump is the
Primary purpose of a pump in a fluid loop is to
The isentropic efficiency of a pump is given by the
choices: ratio of actual to ideal energy extracted
ratio of ideal to actual energy supplied
ratio of mass to actual energy extracted
ratio of actual to ideal energy supplied
answer: ratio of ideal to actual energy supplied

question: The electrical efficiency of a device is the ratio of the:
choices: electrical energy output to the electrical energy input
mechanical energy input to the mechanical energy output of the device
actual energy extracted to the ideal energy extracted
actual to the ideal energy input
answer: electrical energy output to the electrical energy input

question: The adiabatic pump efficiency is the ratio of the:
choices: electrical energy output to the electrical energy input
mechanical energy input to the mechanical energy output of the device
actual energy extracted to the ideal energy extracted
answer: electrical energy output to the electrical energy input

question: A condenser's water - circulating pump is belt-driven by an electric motor with an adjustable pitch motor sheave. This sheave
choices: prevent overload and/or burnout of the pump and motor
prevents excessive wear on the belt and motor shaft bearings
answer: prevents excessive wear on the belt and motor shaft bearings

question: The function of a pump or compressor is to
choices: transfer heat from one fluid to another
increase the total energy content of the flow
exchange heat to increase energy to the flow
answer: increase the total energy content of the flow

question: An aftercooler on a reciprocating air compressor is used primarily to:
choices: condense the moisture in the compressed air
answer: condense the moisture in the compressed air

question: A receiver in an air compression system is used to
choices: collect water and grease suspended in the ail
reduce the work needed during compression
answer: collect water and grease suspended in the ail

question: Crankshaft of reciprocating compressor is basically made of:

Cooling water system consists of equipment to dissipate heat absorbed by the engine jacket water, lube oil and the heat to be removed from air intercooler is measurable to keep the engine outlet water temperature constant and the differential of the cooling water at a minimum preferably not to exceed:
Which of the following is one of the most popular types of compressor utilized for supercharging engine?
The power required to deliver a given quantity of fluid against a given head with no losses in the pump is called:
Fluids that are pumped in processing work are frequently more viscous than water. Which of the following statement is correct?
choices: Reynolds number varies directly as the viscosity
Efficiency of a pump increases as the viscosil increases
Increased fluid friction between the pump parts and the passing fluid increases useful work
Working head increases as the viscosity
answer: Increased fluid friction between the pump parts and the passing fluid increases useful work

question: A reciprocating pump is considered positive displacement pump because
choices: displacement of the liquid is affected by the displacement of the piston
positive pressure is given to the liquid
liquid is discharge with positive pressure
liquid is lifted due to the vacuum created inside the cylinder
answer: displacement of the liquid is affected by the displacement of the piston

question: To protect adequately the engine bearings, what type and better arrangement of lubricating oil filter is most practical?
choices: Full-flow type filter installed between the lubricating oil pump and the bearings
Duplex filter installed before the lubricating pump
Bypass filter with cleanable and replaceable elements
Splash lubricating system in the crank case
answer: Full-flow type filter installed between the lubricating oil pump and the bearings

question: Medium pressure when applied to valves and fittings are suitable for a working pressure of:
The function of an unloader on an electric motor driven compressor is to
choices: reduce the speed of the motor when the maximum pressure is reached
drain the condensate from the cylinder
release the pressure in the cylinder in order to reduce the starting load
prevent excess pressure in the receiver
answer: release the pressure in the cylinder in order to reduce the starting load

question: An unloader is used on air compressor to:
The performance of a reciprocating compressor expressed as:
choices: adiabatic work divided by adiabatic input
adiabatic work divided by indicated work
isothermal work divided by indicated work
isothermal work divided by adiabatic work
answer: adiabatic work divided by indicated work

question: For reciprocating compressor slip at positive or negative displacement.

Which of the following components of a pump converts mechanical energy to pressure energy?
Mr. De La Cruz wanted to buy a pump for his farm. What is suitable for deepwell?
A tank contains H20. What is the intensity of pressure at a depth of 6 meters?
In order to avoid cavitation the NPSH of an installation should be:
choices: at least equal or greater than the NPSH of the pump
at least equal or less than the NPSH of the pump
equal to the NPSH of the pump only
greater than the NPSH of the pump only
answer: at least equal or greater than the NPSH of the pump

question: The actual head, neglecting the kinetic energy in which the pump work against.
Flow of water in a pipe have a velocity at 10 meters per second. Determine the velocity head of the water
Find the velocity head for a velocity of 18 m/s.
The size of a steam reciprocating pumps is generally designated by a three-digit number size as 646. The first digit designates
choices: stroke of the pump in inches
inside diameter of the steam cylinder measured in inches
answer: inside diameter of the steam cylinder measured in inches

question: If Qa is the actual discharge flow and Qb is the theoretical discharge flow, what will the coefficient of discharge be equal to during positive displacement slip?
Two pumps are connected in series. If Q1 is the discharge of Pump 1 and Q2 is the discharge of Pump 2 where Q1 < Q2, what is the discharge?
A pump in which the pressure is developed principally by the action of centrifugal force.
A single suction pump having its suction nozzle on the opposite side of the casing from the stuffing box and having the face of the suction nozzle perpendicular to the longitudinal axis of the shaft.
A pump with the shaft normally in a horizontal position.
A centrifugal pump whose drive unit is supported by the pump having its suction and discharge flanges on approximately the same center.
A centrifugal pump characterized by a housing which is split parallel to the shaft.

A centrifugal pump with one or more impellers discharging into one or more bowls and a vertical eductor or column pipe used to connect the bowls to the discharge head on which the pump driver is mounted.
A pump that takes suction from a public service main or private use water system for the purpose of increasing the effective water pressure.
A vertical turbine pump with the pump and motor closed coupled and design to be installed underground, as in the case of a deepwell pump.
An underground formation that contains sufficient saturated permeable material to yield significant quantities of water.
A timber, concrete or masonry enclosure having a screened inlet kept partially filled with water by an open body of water such as pond, lake, or steams.
Water which is available from a well, driven into Water bearing subsurface strata (aquifer)
The level with respect to the pump, of the body of water from which it takes suction when the pump is not in operation.
The level with respect to the pump, of the body of water from which it takes suction when the pump is in operation.
The vertical difference between the pumping water level and the static water level.
Imparts velocity to the liquid, resulting from centrifugal force as the impeller is rotated.
Gives direction to the flow from the impeller and converts this velocity energy into pressure energy.
A means of throttling the leakage which would otherwise occur at the point of entry of the shaft into the casing.
Protects the shaft where it passes through the stuffing box.
Keeps internal recirculation down to a minimum.
Accurately locate shaft and carry radial and thrust loads.
Which of the following is used to mount unit rigidly and support bearings.
Connects the pump to the driver.
The most common means of throttling the leakage between the inside and outside of the casing
To position and adjust the packing pressure.
Provides passage to distribute the sealing medium uniformly around the portion of the shaft that passes through the stuffing box. Also known as water seal of lantern ring.
Provides a mechanical sealing arrangement that takes the place of the packing.
A positive displacement pump consisting of a fixed casing containing gears, cams, screws, vanes, plungers or similar elements actuated by rotation of the drive shaft.
A positive displacement unit wherein the pumping action is accomplished by the forward and backward movement of a piston or plunger inside a cylinder usually provided with valves.

A type of rotary pump, consist of an eccentrically bored cam rotated by a shaft concentric in a cylindrically bored casing, with an aburment or follower so arranged that with each rotation of the drive shaft a positive quantity of liquid is displaced from the space between the cam and the pump casing.

A type of rotary pump, consists of two or more gears, operating in closely fitted casing so arranged that when the gear teeth unmesh on one side liquid fills the space between the gear teeth and is carried around in the tooth space to the opposite side and displaced as the teeth mesh again.
A type of rotary pump, consists of two or three screw rotors so arranged that as the rotors turn liquid fills the shape between the screw threads and is displaced axially as the rotor threads mesh.

A type of rotary pump, consists of one rotor in a casing machined eccentrically to the drive shaft. The rotor is fitted with a series of vanes, blades or buckets which follow the bore of the casing thereby displacing the liquid with each revolution of the drive shaft.
A type reciprocating pump having a steam cylinder with no lap on valves, a water cylinder and a common piston rod.
A type of reciprocating pump driven by compound cross compound, or triple expansion steam engines
A type of reciprocating pump that receives its forward and backward motion of the piston and plunger from the rotary motion of a revolving crankshaft by means of a crank and connecting rod.
A type of deep well pump which are refinement of the old hand pump that have played such an important role in country home and small town water supply from wells.
A type of deep well pump that represent the application of vertical centrifugal pump to deep well service and are built for heads up to 305 meters and for capacities Up to 26,495 liters per minute.
A type of deep well pump that has come into wide use for small capacities combines a single stage centrifugal pump at the top of the well and an ejector or jet located down in the water.

A type of deep well pump wherein compressed air is admitted to the well to lift water to the surface, for successful operation of the system, the discharge pipe must have its lower end submerged in the well water.
